title: Google\Cloud\Speech\V1p1beta1\StreamingRecognitionConfig
name: StreamingRecognitionConfig
description:
Provides information to the recognizer that specifies how to process the request.

Generated from protobuf message google.cloud.speech.v1p1beta1.StreamingRecognitionConfig

Extends Google\Protobuf\Internal\Message

params.name: data
params.description: Optional. Data for populating the Message object.

params.name: data.config
params.description: Required. Provides information to the recognizer that specifies how to process the request.

params.name: data.single_utterance
params.description: If false or omitted, the recognizer will perform continuous recognition (continuing to wait for and process audio even if the user pauses speaking) until the client closes the input stream (gRPC API) or until the maximum time limit has been reached. May return multiple StreamingRecognitionResults with the is_final flag set to true. If true, the recognizer will detect a single spoken utterance. When it detects that the user has paused or stopped speaking, it will return an END_OF_SINGLE_UTTERANCE event and cease recognition. It will return no more than one StreamingRecognitionResult with the is_final flag set to true.

params.name: data.interim_results
params.description: If true, interim results (tentative hypotheses) may be returned as they become available (these interim results are indicated with the is_final=false flag). If false or omitted, only is_final=true result(s) are returned.

methods.description:
Required. Provides information to the recognizer that specifies how to process the request.

methods.name: getSingleUtterance
methods.description:
If false or omitted, the recognizer will perform continuous recognition (continuing to wait for and process audio even if the user pauses speaking) until the client closes the input stream (gRPC API) or until the maximum time limit has been reached. May return multiple StreamingRecognitionResults with the is_final flag set to true.

If true, the recognizer will detect a single spoken utterance. When it detects that the user has paused or stopped speaking, it will return an END_OF_SINGLE_UTTERANCE event and cease recognition. It will return no more than one StreamingRecognitionResult with the is_final flag set to true.

Generated from protobuf field bool single_utterance = 2;

If false or omitted, only is_final=true result(s) are returned.
